abstract: Psychiatrist Michael Welner testifies that Pedro Hernandez, man accused of murdering 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979, does not have serious mental illness and was capable of distinguishing fact from fiction when he confessed to police after six-hour interview.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Michael Welner also testified that he had found no evidence that Pedro Hernandez was delusional when he told people that he had killed a child in New York.

headline.main: Patz Murder Suspect Could Distinguish Fact From Fiction, Psychiatrist Says
headline.print_headline: Patz Murder Suspect Could Distinguish Fact From Fiction, Psychiatrist Says

snippet: Dr. Michael Welner also testified that he had found no evidence that Pedro Hernandez was delusional when he told people that he had killed a child in New York.
